content.prompt: Which of the following could be the graph of y=Nt for  0 ≤ t ≤ 16 ?

choices.label:
• The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at the origin and increases to a relative maximum at t equals 4.
    • The curve decreases back to the horizontal axis to reach a relative minimum at t equals 8.
    • The curve increases to a relative maximum at t equals 12. Both relative maxima appear to have the same y coordinate.
    • The curve decreases to reach the horizontal axis at t equals 16.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option A. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins on the positive y axis and decreases to reach a relative minimum on the horizontal axis at t equals 4.
    • The curve increases to reach a relative maximum at t equals 8. This relative maximum and the beginning point of the curve appear to have the same y coordinate.
    • The curve decreases to reach a relative minimum on the horizontal axis at t equals 12.
    • The curve increases to its ending point at t equals 16. The y coordinate of this point appears to be equal to the y coordinate of the beginning point.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option B. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at the origin.
    • The curve increases to t equals 4 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 4.
    • The curve increases from t equals 4 to t equals 8.
    • The curve increases from t equals 8 to t equals 12 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 12.
    • The curve increases from t equals 12 to t equals 16, at which point it ends.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option C. Refer to its long description

choices.label:
• The horizontal, or t, axis ranges from 0 to 16 in increments of 1. The y axis shows no tick marks and no scale.
  • Moving from left to right:
    • The curve begins at the origin.
    • The curve begins nearly horizontal and then increases to t equals 4.
    • The curve increases from t equals 4 to t equals 8 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal at t equals 8.
    • The curve increases from t equals 8 to t equals 12.
    • The curve increases from t equals 12 to t equals 16 at a less steep rate, and becomes nearly horizontal again at t equals 16, at which point it ends.

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option D. Refer to its long description

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
